description: Woman's Day Magazine, the flagship of CBS Publications, will be trimming its average circulation rate base for 17 annual issues by 3.8 percent, to 6.31 million, from 6.56 million, with its April 15 issue. At the same time, it will increase its rates 1.2 percent.

title: COACH'S CAREER REFLECTS RISE IN WOMEN'S SPORTS
description: THERE are two framed photographs of her daughter Michelle prominently displayed in the office at Old Dominion University where Marianne Stanley presides over the most successful women's basketball program in the country. The photos help keep her priorities in order. So does the Van Gogh that hangs on the wall behind her desk. The work of art represents her individuality, Mrs. Stanley said. It stirs fantasies about living in New England, having given up coaching for a more serene life and chance to dabble in art herself.

title: REACH FOR THE SKY
description: Ed Jones, the Cowboy defensive end who is 6 feet 9 inches tall and can reach 9 feet into the sky, set the scene at Texas Stadium today. The Giants, ahead by 14-7 with 2 minutes left before halftime, were at the Dallas 22-yard line with a first down.

title: BUCKS CRUSH KINGS BY 58-POINT MARGIN
description: Terry Cummings poured in 21 points to lead eight Milwaukee players in double figures tonight as the Bucks trounced Sacramento, 140-82.

title: MUSIC: SCHUMAN CONCERTO AND 10TH SYMPHONY
description: EVEN if William Schuman had never written a note, his achievements as president of the Juilliard School from 1945 until 1962 and then as the first president of Lincoln Center would have earned him an honorable place in the history of American music.

title: CONSERVATIVES PUSH FOR U.S. AID TO ANGOLA REBELS
description: Conservatives plan to make aid for Angolan rebels their primary foreign-policy objective next year, according to spokesmen for several conservative lobbying groups.

title: MUSIC: VLADMIR HOROWITZ PERFORMS
description: FOR more than half a century, Vladimir Horowitz has been recognized by pianists as a force of nature, a phenomenon not to be explained in ordinary musical terms. The general musical public, too, long ago accepted him, as a tourist's visit to Niagara Falls is accepted, as an experience that should not be missed in the course of any richly lived lifetime. So it was no surprise to find Carnegie Hall filled yesterday afternoon with Horowitz admirers primed to look and listen to the great man. His two-year absence from New York's stages obviously whetted appetites, as his periodic absences and returns often have in the past. Those appetites were satisfied for the most part.

title: EXCERPTS FROM AQUINO INTERVIEW ON CANDIDACY
description: Following are excerpts from Corazon C. Aquino's responses in an interview today with The New York Times:

title: Almost a Billion Africans by the Year 2000
description: To the Editor:

title: ABDUL-JABBAR AT 38: STILL IN FINE STYLE
description: THE rhythm to which Kareem Abdul-Jabbar has played, and lived, for most of his 38 years has always been a different one. From the clumsy beginnings of his signature skyhook in a crowded playground in junior high to his days as a mainstream member of the 60's counter-culture and onward through this, his 17th season in professional basketball, he has remained emblematic of a generation whose ideal was to bow to no one's will - sing no one's song - but its own.

title: No Headline
description: Following is a list of the 248 soldiers aboard the Arrow Air charter jet that crashed Thursday in Gander, Newfoundland, as made public by the Defense Department: ABRAMS, Mark Edward, Pfc., Rhodell, W. Va. ALEXANDER, Herbert, Pfc., Ponchatoula, La.

title: A Humbug Double-Bill
description: On Broadway is a theater marquee to delight Scrooge or any other misanthrope on your Christmas list. The advertisement of two movies at the United Artists Twin, between 49th and 50th Streets, reads:

title: 4 Hurt and 30 Families Left Homeless After Queens Fire
description: A fire swept through a seven-story apartment building last night in Jamaica, Queens, causing minor injuries to four people, three of them firefighters, and leaving at least 30 families homeless.

title: SENATOR WOULD REQUIRE TRUCKERS TO HAVE FEDERAL DRIVER'S LICENSE
description: A leading highway safety advocate in the Senate has introduced legislation that would require interstate truck and bus drivers to have a Federal driver's license. Some trucking industry leaders are supporting the proposal, while state motor vehicle administrators are opposed.

title: NICARAGUA DENIES CHARGE BY REAGAN
description: Interior Minister Tomas Borge has denied an assertion by President Reagan that Nicaragua supplied weapons to leftist guerrillas who staged a takeover of Colombia's Palace of Justice last month.

title: Faster Test Found For Sickle Cells
description: Researchers say they have developed a speedier and more sensitive method of doing prenatal diagnosis of sickle cell disease, and perhaps some other inherited illnesses.

title: Nausea in Chemotherapy
description: The Food and Drug Administration has approved use of synthetic THC, the psychoactive ingredient in marijuana, for treating the nausea and vomiting that often result from cancer chemotherapy. In past years, the drug has been available directly from the National Cancer Institute but now the way has been cleared for commercial production, according to The Medical Letter.

title: DIGILOG INC reports earnings for Year to Sept 30
description: b-After a net loss from discontinued operations of $294,524 and a gain of $138,904 on the sale of discontinued operations. c-Including a net gain of $6,822 from discontinued operations.

title: $92.2 Million Set For Sewer Bonds
description: The Metropolitan Government of Nashville and Davidson County, Tenn., is offering $92.2 million of tax-exempt water and sewer revenue bonds that were tentatively priced with a maximum yield of 8 3/4 percent for bonds due in 2016 through underwriters led by Bear, Stearns & Company.

title: NEUTROGENA CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
TO COMBAT AIDS, KOCH URGES ANTI-DRUG EFFORT
description: Mayor Koch called on Governor Cuomo yesterday to increase drug-treatment programs in New York City sharply to help combat the spread of AIDS among drug addicts.

title: Careers;   New Skills Sought in Executives
description: FROM time to time, management recruiting firms take surveys of their clients or of resumes received from managers to find out what top managers are thinking and which former executives are seeking corporate jobs again.

title: DART GROUP reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: b-Including income from operations of discontinued drug store division of $1,010,000 and a net gain of $75 million on the sale of drug store division.

title: 11 DEAD IN PROPANE BLAST IN COLORADO
description: A propane tank explosion today leveled a two-story gas company office and repair garage, killing 11 people and leaving one person missing in smoky rubble, the authorities said.

title: ROCKEFELLER ESTATE LOSES PLEA ON TAXES IN SUPREME COURT
description: The Supreme Court today let stand two lower court rulings holding that Nelson A. Rockefeller was not entitled to deduct from his taxes $550,000 he spent in his successful quest for Senate confirmation as Vice President in 1974.

title: Dairy Queen Amendments
description: International Dairy Queen Inc. said it had approved proposed amendments to the company's certificate of incorporation that includes a program to convert each existing share of its common stock into three shares of a new class A common stock and two shares of a new class B common stock. It said the amendments would divide its existing common stock into a larger number of shares of two classes, with differing rights and preferences.

title: NEWS SUMMARY: TUESDAY, DECEMBER 17, 1985
description: International American pressure to remove the Philippines' Chief of Staff, Gen. Fabian C. Ver, contributed to a factional dispute that is hampering the work of the military, President Ferdinand E. Marcos said. Mr. Marcos, who despite this pressure reinstated General Ver after his acquittal on charges of involvement in the slaying of Benigno S. Aquino Jr., said in an interview that he expected the general to be removed from his post soon. [Page A1, Column 2.]

title: Alexander's Filing
description: Bass/ Alexander's Limited Partnership said that it had raised its stake in Alexander's Inc., the New York department-store chain, to 21.5 percent of the company's outstanding shares.

title: NEW OWNER TO RENOVATE 3D-BIGGEST L.I. RETAIL MALL
description: Few trends in merchandising have had as much impact on retailing as the regional shopping center. Many were built in the 1950's and 1960's as the nation's suburban housing developments took shape.

title: JURY DEADLOCKED ON EDWARDS'S CASE
description: The Federal jury in the trial of Gov. Edwin W. Edwards today said it was deadlocked on the charges against him but found the Governor's brother and co-defendant, Marion, not guilty of 41 counts of a 50-count indictment.

title: Union Leaders Meet To Assess Steel Talks
description: Hundreds of officers of the United Steelworkers of America convened here today to take stock of the industry and consider how to resist giving other companies the breaks granted to the Wheeling-Pittsburgh Steel Corporation.

title: Woman Is Convicted In Death of Husband, 80
description: A 65-year-old woman was convicted Sunday of murdering her 80-year-old husband, who prosecutors say was shot and his body chopped up and burned.

title: PLANE'S SPEED DETERMINED, BUT MUCH STUDY LIES AHEAD
description: The Arrow Air DC-8 that crashed here Thursday reached a speed of 165 knots, more than fast enough for a normal takeoff, and then slowed before smashing into the ground, Canadian investigators said here today.

title: MASSEY-FERGUSON LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: The company said it is in arrears on its preferred share dividends. All results are in U. S. funds.

title: DIGICON INC reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: b-After a net loss of $1,415,000 from discontinued operations and an extraordinary gain of $340,000.

title: Key Rates
description: * Municipal Bond Index, The Bond Buyer Salomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: LONG-TERM U.S. BONDS CLIMB
description: Long-term Treasury bond prices jumped sharply yesterday, with most of the gains coming in a burst of activity early in the afternoon when traders learned that Henry Kaufman, chief economist at Salomon Brothers, expected interest rates to continue declining through early next year and heard reports that Mexico might reduce its oil prices.

title: CORRECTION
description: Because of an editing error, the Sky Watch map in late editions on Sunday mislabeled the path to be followed by the Moon later this week. The path is that of the summer solstice sun.

title: PLIGHT OF HOMELESS STIR DONORS TO NEEDIEST
description: The sight of the homeless huddled against the bitter cold on the city's streets has brought many donations to the 74th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: GIVE THE GIFT OF CURIOSITY
description: IT'S that time to buy new toys - mock babies, mock zappers. A kid is entitled to some simple atavistic fantasies, after all, and both childrearing and combat underlie the primal human condition.

title: BAY FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
description: b-Net income.

title: PSYCHOTHERAPY, AT 100, IS MARKED BY DEEP DIVISIONS ON APPROACHES
description: PSYCHOTHERAPY, after a century of existence, has splintered into factions so diverse that there is little agreement on exactly what psychotherapy is, how it should proceed or what it should accomplish. And despite the best of ecumenical efforts, the deep divisions seem to be getting even deeper.

title: Comings and Goings
description: The former Notre Dame coach, Gerry Faust, interviewed for the job at Rice University over the weekend, said he would like to make a decision ''by the end of the week'' on coaching opportunities at three schools. Faust is also considering offers from Youngstown State and Marshall. . . . The Islanders recalled the defenseman Gerald Diduck from their top affiliate in the minor leagues, the Springfield Indians of the American Hockey League.

title: GETTING THE MOST OUT OF A DOT-MATRIX PRINTER
description: THERE have been many impressive advances in dot-matrix impact printers lately, transforming what was once a fairly crude and homely technology into a showcase of speed, color, versatility and value.

title: New York State Milk Laws Also Harm Grocery-Store Owners
description: To the Editor:

title: SPORTING LIFE reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: b-Including tax credits of $70,000 for the latest first quarter and $55,000 for the year-ago period.

title: CUBIC CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
CONGRESSIONAL CONFEREES END FINANCING OF SYNTHETIC FUELS PROGRAM
description: The United States Synthetic Fuels Corporation, conceived in 1980 as the investment-banker catalyst of a huge new industry, was effectively killed today by a vote of Congressional conferees.

title: ENGINE REVERSAL A THEORY IN CRASH
description: Investigators were focusing increasing attention yesterday on the possibility that the the crash of a chartered airliner in Newfoundland last week was caused by a reversal of power in one of the engines.

title: KOCH LIMITS USING WELFARE HOTELS
description: In a new policy ordered by Mayor Koch, homeless families seeking emergency housing will be sent to dormitory-like shelters, not welfare hotels, unless the shelters are full.

title: 5 ORGANIZED-CRIME FACTIONS OPERATING IN NEW YORK AREA
description: For more than three decades, five major organized-crime syndicates in the New York area - collectively called the Mafia or La Cosa Nostra -have been known to law-enforcement officials.

title: The Fight Over Gasoline Fumes
description: Lee M. Thomas, Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, is once again about to offend a powerful lobby.

title: BRIEFS
description: * Allied-Signal Inc., Morristown, N.J., said it would include some chemical operations in the Henley Group, a new company it plans to form by spinning off about 30 operations.

title: POP MUSIC: THOMPSON TWINS
description: THE British trio known as the Thompson Twins has developed a style of cheerful, danceable pop that reduces many of the elements of new-wave music into a likable cartoon.

title: WILLIAMS-SONOMA INC reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 3
description: b-Net losses.

title: FOR THRIVING FURRIERS, PROTESTERS POSE THREAT
description: Nearly 500 protesters, some dressed as skeletons, some as Santa Claus, staged sit-ins at retail stores across the country this weekend, handing printed cards to customers who were wearing furs. ''Enjoy your coat,'' the message read. ''Its real owner was killed in it.''

title: The U.N. Today; Dec. 17, 1985
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Meets at 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: THE STAGE: 'MARRIAGE'
description: The theatrical reputation of Nikolai Gogol rests on one play, ''The Inspector General.'' The imperishability of that tragic farce was resoundingly demonstrated in a recent production at London's National Theater. Gogol was also the author of the full-length ''Marriage'' and several shorter plays, and though they are seldom performed, there is always the hope that one of them will prove to be of equal rank. Such is not the case with ''Marriage,'' at least as seen in Andrei Belgrader's revival at the Yale Repertory Theater.

title: U.N. Food Agency Says African Crisis Is Ending
description: Africa's food emergency is ending, but the continent ''will speed headlong to another catastrophe'' if farming is not improved, the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization said today.

title: DOLPHINS WIN ON 47-YARD KICK
description: The Miami Dolphins moved to within one game of winning their third straight American Conference East title tonight by defeating the New England Patriots, 30-27.

title: CONDITIONAL APPROVAL GIVEN ON U.P.I. PURCHASE ACCORD
description: Subject to one amendment, a Federal bankruptcy judge said today that he would approve a motion that would push forward the prospective acquisition of United Press International by Mario Vazquez Rana, a Mexican newspaper publisher.

title: PURLOINED SWEATER: A CASE OF WHO COPIED WHOM FIRST
description: Early in 1984, Crolla, an English fashion design team, showed a collection of flamboyant tapestrylike floral print clothes. Sherlock Holmes might call what happened next the Case of the Cabbage Roses.

title: Judge Brennan Resigns After Bribe Conviction
description: Justice William C. Brennan of State Supreme Court in Queens, who was convicted last week of bribery, racketeering and other charges in a Federal court jury trial, has resigned, court officials said yesterday.

title: Presser Might Testify At Trial on Skimming
description: A defense lawyer in the casino skimming trial of eight reputed organized-crime figures says he will subpoena Jackie Presser, president of the teamsters' union, to testify next month.

title: STERCHI BROTHERS STORES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
Another Hat in the Ring
description: Tempted by a political vacuum, the former chairman of the Citizens Union, Terence H. Benbow, said yesterday that he would seek the Democratic nomination to challenge Senator Alfonse M. D'Amato, Republican of New York.

title: Cuomo Signs Takeover Bill
description: Governor Cuomo signed yesterday what he called a unique law to curb hostile takeovers of New York corporations and said he believed it was ''invulnerable'' to legal challenge.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST: TUESDAY, DECEMBER 17, 1985
description: The Economy

title: THE STAGE: 'TIMES SQUARE ANGEL'
description: CHARLES BUSCH, Macdougal Street's king, or queen, of camp, is back. Not that he has been away. For the last six months, he has been appearing at the Provincetown Playhouse in his own ''Vampire Lesbians of Sodom,'' playing Madeleine Astarte, a stage actress, and A Virgin Sacrifice, as well as a fashion designer named Fauna Alexander in a companion piece, ''Sleeping Beauty'' or ''Coma.'' Now here he is yet again, as Irish O'Flanagan, in his play ''Times Square Angel,'' which is being performed in repertory with his other works.

title: Chips and Promises
description: Usually there are two things that can be done with bargaining chips - bargain with them or save them. The Administration has been trying to establish a third use -to extract money from Congress for policies Congress opposes.

title: XL/DATACOMP INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Name That Fast Food
description: Fast-food restaurants, a $47 billion industry, supply a large part of the American diet. Yet their consumers have little idea of the ingredients mixed into their burgers, fries and shakes.

title: Market Place;   Tobacco Stock Uncertainties
description: TOBACCO stocks had been the orphans of Wall Street's three-month rally until a few days ago. Then, bargain-starved investors started to claim custody of such stocks as Philip Morris and R. J. Reynolds Industries on the basis of two favorable court rulings in product liability suits.

title: BLOOD CLUES IN ANCIENT BONES
description: SURVIVING fragments of the blood substance hemoglobin have been detected in the bones of humans who died as far back as 4,500 years ago, Italian medical scientists report.

title: Chess: Czech Grandmaster Wins Baden-Baden International
description: Jan Smejkal, a 39-year-old Czechoslovakian grandmaster, scored 9-4 to win first prize in the Baden-Baden International Tournament.

title: JAMES RIVER WILL BUY A SMALLER ZELLERBACH
description: The James River Corporation, in a move that would make it the nation's fourth-largest paper company, said yesterday that it had signed a definitive agreement to acquire nearly all of a scaled-down Crown Zellerbach Corporation. Analysts and sources close to the company said the value of the stock swap could be nearly $800 million. The agreement was approved by both company boards.

title: T.W.A. Offer
description: The Texas Air Corporation said it was willing to acquire Trans World Airlines for $22 a share in cash if merger negotiations between T.W.A. directors and the financier, Carl C. Icahn, break down. Texas Air lost the bidding for T.W.A. to Mr. Icahn, who now owns about 52 percent of the airline company and is offering to buy the rest. Mr. Icahn has proposed restructuring his offer to make it easier for him to raise the $800 million to $1 billion to finance the deal. Specifically, he has proposed that the $24-a-share offer he made to stockholders on Aug. 6 be changed to reduce the cash portion to about $15 a share, from $19.50.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: BARBARA COOK RETURNS Several months ago, Barbara Cook appeared with the New York Philharmonic in a concert version of Stephen Sondheim's ''Follies.'' But it has been three years since the musical comedy star has appeared in a New York nightclub, a milieu that she had performed in for many years.

title: CABLE TV INDUSTRIES reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
PENWEST LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
description: The share earnings and shares outstanding are fully diluted.

title: Penalties in Bache Case
description: Prudential-Bache Securities, the former head of its over-the-counter trading department and two of its stock traders have been given fines and suspensions on charges that they manipulated the price of an over-the-counter stock. The sanctions were announced yesterday by the National Association of Securities Dealers.

title: BUCS COULD CLINCH TOP CHOICE IN DRAFT
description: As three more National Football League division races ended this weekend, with Dallas and the two Los Angeles teams winning to wrap up titles, the Tampa Bay Buccaneers moved within one game of ending another race.

title: Seidman Merger
description: The accounting firm of Nathan, Ettinger & Shewach of Detroit will merge with Seidman & Seidman/BDO, the nation's 13th-largest accounting firm, the companies said.

title: NASA Chief Enters Plea
description: The General Dynamics Corporation, three of its executives, and James M. Beggs of the space agency today pleaded not guilty to fraud charges relating to cost overruns on a prototype of the Sergeant York antiaircraft gun.

title: Folk Music Trio
description: Metamora, the folk music trio, will perform tomorrow at 8 P.M. at the Public School 41 theater, 116 West Eleventh Street, at Avenue of the Americas.

title: ASSAM VOTES QUIETLY 2 YEARS AFTER RIOTS
description: As tens of thousands of policemen and paramilitary troopers kept watch, the residents of Assam turned out in large numbers today to vote in a statewide election that is seen as a crucial test for Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi's political control over the state.

title: 'ADVENTURES OF SANTA'
description: THERE is nothing quite like a perennial Christmas special for bringing a warm glow to the reports of network accountants. Dragged out year after year, the programs pay for themselves many times over and save the networks the trouble of turning out too many new productions. The studio of Arthur Rankin Jr. and Jules Bass has produced at least two of those holiday ''classics'' - ''Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer'' and ''Frosty the Snowman.'' Tonight at 8 on CBS, it is weighing in with still another animation candidate for scheduling longevity: ''The Life and Adventures of Santa Claus.'' It shows every sign of being around for a while.

title: Culture for the Schools
description: To bridge the gulf between the city's schools and its cultural organizations, the Alliance for the Arts has created the Schools and Culture Project.

title: CARBIDE PLAN SENDS SHARES UP
description: The Union Carbide Corporation's plan to defend itself from a takeover through a repurchase of its own shares sent the stock price higher today.

title: ORGANIZED-CRIME CHIEF SHOT DEAD STEPPING FROM CAR ON E. 46TH ST.
description: Paul Castellano, the reputed leader of the nation's largest and most powerful crime organization, and an underworld associate were shot to death late yesterday afternoon by three assassins on a busy street on Manhattan's East Side.

title: NEXT ON THE CONCERT TRAIL
description: IT was the 24th of the 26 private dinner concerts in honor of Johann Sebastian Bach's 300th birthday, and Judith Norell, harpsichordist extraordinaire, was about to attack the master's Partita No. 4 in D Major, BWV 828. Suddenly, she heard a humming sound.

title: Working Profile: Kent Cooper;   An Answer Man
description: A journalist recently walked into the office of the Public Records Section of the Federal Election Commission, seeking information concerning a New York lawyer who represented 200 Japanese corporations in the United States. The journalist wanted to find out if the lawyer had contributed to the 1984 Congressional campaigns, to whom and how much.

title: MOUSE SKATES, PAPER PLANES AND OTHER YULE GIFTS
description: THERE may not be a computer under every tree this Christmas as the industry hoped, but the machines have made it a lot easier to buy gifts for people who already have computers. There seems to be an endless assortment of accessories and gimmicks to be bought for computer owners. The digital world, like almost any other these days, involves continual accumulation. There is always just one more gadget to be had. The trick is to avoid buying someone yet another uninspiring tie - or, in this case, yet another box of floppies.

title: Kranz Is Sentenced
description: Gary Kranz, identified by witnesses as the mastermind of the Tulane University basketball point-shaving scandal, was sentenced in New Orleans to serve three months in jail, pay a $45,000 fine and perform 1,500 hours of community service. It was Kranz, witnesses testified, who obtained cocaine for Tulane basketball players and eventually broached the subject of fixing games.

title: BRIEFS
description: Debt Issues

title: Nixon Tribute Proposed
description: It has been more than a decade since President Nixon left office amid scandal, and now, says a California Congressman, it is time to pay him a tribute accorded most other chief executives.

title: Argentina's Trial, Latin Tribulations
description: The conviction last week of five Argentine military commanders for waging a ''dirty war'' against their own people is obviously an encouraging precedent for democracy in Latin America. But democrats elsewhere in the hemisphere, especially in Central America, who have endured similar reigns of terror still find hopes of human rights trials elusive. Not the least of their burdens is the legacy of Reagan Administration policy.

title: ENGINEERS FIX ORIGINAL DEFECTS IN THE STATUE
description: RESTORATION of the Statue of Liberty has reached the halfway mark, and engineers are convinced they have solved the major problems they faced when they began the project.

title: Advertising;   People
description: Robert Nelson, executive producer, and Tod Seisser, associate creative director, promoted to senior vice president at Levine, Huntley, Schmidt & Beaver.

title: WINGS WEST AIRLINES reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
EAGLES CONSIDER DAVID SHULA
description: Norman Braman, the owner of the Philadelphia Eagles, said tonight that David Shula, the receiver and quarterback coach of the Miami Dolphins, was ''the major candidate'' to replace Marion Campbell, who was dismissed today as the head coach. Braman also said that he would decide shortly if he would interview any other candidates.

title: U.S. Panel Drops Limits On China Nuclear Pact
description: Congressional negotiators, acting under strong pressure from the White House, today dropped a proposal that would have placed restrictions on the sale of American nuclear technology to China.

title: ANDERSON TO RETIRE AS ARCO CHAIRMAN
description: Robert O. Anderson, the eclectic oilman who has headed the Atlantic Richfield Company since May 1965, announced yesterday that he would step down as chairman Jan. 1.

title: HALLEY'S COMET
description: Halley's Comet will rise over the New York City area at 11:08 A.M. today and set at 11:30 P.M. tomorrow.

title: Rebels Say They Caused Blast in South Africa
description: The African National Congress guerrilla group today claimed responsibility for the land mine explosion that killed six people Sunday near the South Africa-Zimbabwe border.

title: '86 SPENDING ACT REJECTED IN HOUSE
description: The House of Representatives rejected a catchall appropriation bill for the rest of the fiscal year 1986 Monday night, with both Republicans and Democrats angered by provisions in the military budget.

title: CANDOR FROM JOHN MADDEN
description: Thwack! Boom! Bam! Raaa-umph!

title: POSSIBILITY OF OIL PRICE WAR SPELLS TROUBLE IN SOUTHWEST
description: The prospect of an oil price war waged by OPEC against other oil-producing nations may be good news for most of the country, but it spells serious trouble for Oklahoma, Texas and Louisiana.

title: SYRIA DEFENDS MISSILE PLACEMENT
description: Syria acknowledged today that it had stationed surface-to-air missiles along its border with Lebanon and said it was within its right of self-defense to station missiles anywhere in Syrian territory.

title: From the South Bronx To the Shuttle Launching
description: When the space shuttle Columbia lifts off tomorrow morning from Cape Canaveral, Fla., 30 students from the South Bronx will be watching.

title: LONG-DISTANCE TEACHING
description: For Patrick Anthony, a 17-year-old honors student in one of the most rural and impoverished counties in the state, the logic of calculus comes easily. So easily that the 12th grader muttered the other day in his advanced class that the teacher had assigned an eighth grade problem.

title: MICRON TECHNOLOGY INC reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 27
description: b-Net income.

title: PENTAGON ASSAILS PROPOSED ANTI-SATELLITE TEST BAN
description: The White House and the Defense Department today sharply criticized a pending Congressional proposal to ban further testing of anti-satellite weapons, saying that such a ban would send the wrong signal to Moscow.

title: Officials Eager to Sell Airport Finance Issues
description: Although airport financings are not subject to restrictions so severe as those proposed for other kinds of tax-exempt bonds, officials around the country are nevertheless attempting to sell their securities before 1986, when the new restrictions could take place.

title: POP: TODD RUNDGREN
description: ''TODD RUNDGREN AND HIS 11-VOICE ORCHESTRA,'' the billing for Friday night's concert at the Beacon Theater (2124 Broadway, at 74th Street), should have added ''plus taped instruments.''

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''In life they were our heroes, in death our loved ones, our darlings.'' - President Reagan. [A1:3.]

title: ABDUCTIONS IN SALVADOR FILL A DEMAND: ADOPTION
description: A stranger snatched a baby from a woman's arms the other day.

title: U.S. STEEL IN KOREAN IMPORT PLAN
description: The United States Steel Corporation yesterday announced a far-reaching joint venture with a South Korean steelmaker that will eventually make South Korea the primary supplier of steel for U.S. Steel's finishing plant at Pittsburg, Calif.

title: VARI-CARE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: Share earnings reflect a 4-for-3 stock split in April.

title: The Name Game
description: All Senators have their names emblazoned on the entrance doors to their formal suites in office buildings surrounding the Capitol. But those who also have hideaway offices in the Capitol itself are careful to keep them anonymous, identfied only by a room number, like S-206, on the door.

title: BROOKLYN BRIDGE HIT BY 5 ROBBERIES IN 6 DAYS
description: The Brooklyn Bridge, usually a safe pedestrian route between Brooklyn and Manhattan, has been struck by five robberies since the beginning of the month, police officials said yesterday.

title: Hasn't Lost Touch
description: Looking like a better representative for ''Tastes Great'' than ''Less Filling,'' Luis Tiant, who does a commerical for Miller Lite beer, insists he could still beef up a major league pitching staff. ''I can still get people out,'' Tiant said.

title: Better Safety Standards, at Last
description: Belatedly, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration has proposed new standards for workers exposed to two substances suspected of causing cancer and other illnesses. The action is less a cause for applause than for relief.

title: NU-MED INC reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
BOOKS OF THE TIMES
description: THE BURNING FOREST. Essays on Chinese Culture and Politics. By Simon Leys. 257 pages. A New Republic Book/Holt, Rinehart & Winston. $16.95.

title: A 'DEREGULATION PURIST' TO BE I.C.C. CHAIRMAN
description: To many people in the railroad and trucking industries, Heather J. Gradison is the deregulator of deregulators.

title: Soviet Calls 'Star Wars' Weak
description: A Soviet military specialist outlined possible countersteps Monday that he said would convert into ''useless junk'' the kind of space-based missile defense envisioned by President Reagan.

title: KULICKE & SOFFA INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Including tax credits of $4,994,000 for the quarter and $5,340,000 for the year. c-Net income.

title: DRAMATISTS PAY TRIBUTE TO GIVERS OF DREAMS
description: ''All artists dream,'' said John Guare, ''and when they dream, they dream of money.''

title: WEST POINT-PEPPERELL INC reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
U.S. ANNOUNCES $900,000 FINE IN ACCIDENT AT OHIO NUCLEAR PLANT
description: A Toledo utility was fined a record $900,000 by the Nuclear Regulatory Commission today for a series of violations that led to one of the worst nuclear plant mishaps since the accident at Three Mile Island in Pennsylvania.

title: 'THE PLANE THAT CHANGED THE WORLD' ON 'NOVA'
description: ''THE PLANE THAT CHANGED THE WORLD'' is a nice piece of work.

title: $625.1 Million Bond Offering
description: The North Carolina Municipal Power Agency is offering $625.1 million of bonds to refund previously sold debt through underwriters led by Merrill Lynch Capital Markets.

title: Gorman Issues Goal Outline
description: What Tom Gorman is expected to accomplish as the new United States Davis Cup captain is pursuade John McEnroe and Jimmy Connors to rejoin the team, impress upon any and all team members that unsportsmanlike behavior is unbecoming, and then win the cup at least as often as Arthur Ashe did in his five years as the captain.

title: A CASE OF AIDS AND A WEB OF ANGUISH
description: On a hot day last August, Patrick McCalister discovered a purplish spot on his leg. He had been walking in the country the weekend before and thought it might be a bug bite. But when the mark did not go away, he went to see a doctor.

title: TUESDAY SPORTS
description: Basketball Knicks vs. Los Angeles Lakers, at Madison Square Garden, 8 P.M. This is Patrick Ewing's first professional meeting with Kareem Abdul-Jabbar. The Knicks' rookie was taught a lesson about playing the inside by Moses Malone in the Knicks' opener against the Philadelphia 76ers, and now must cope with Abdul-Jabbar's skyhook. (Television -MSG, 8 P.M. Radio - WPAT, 930; 8 P.M.). Nets vs. Hawks, at Atlanta, 7:30 P.M. Despite a 30- point performance by Atlanta's Dominique Wilkins, the Nets scored a 107-97 victory over the Hawks Nov. 29. Last season they split the six games between them. (Television - SportsChannel, 11:30 P.M. tape following the Islanders game. Radio - WNBC, 660; 7:30 P.M. live). Colleges North Carolina at Jacksonville (Television - ESPN, 8 P.M.); Sacred Heart at C. W. Post, 7:30 P.M. (Radio - WCWP-FM, 88.1; 7:30 P.M.). Hockey Islanders vs. Buffalo Sabres, at Uniondale, L.I., Nassau Coliseum, 8:05 P.M. The Islanders split the two games played with the Sabres at the Nassau Coliseum last season but took the season series, 2 games to 1, with a victory in Buffalo. The next two games with the Sabres will both be in Buffalo. (Television -SportsChannel, 8 P.M. Radio - WOR, 710; 8 P.M.). Devils vs. Philadelphia Flyers, at East Rutherford, N.J., Byrne Meadowlands Arena, 7:35 P.M. Paul Gagne, the Devils' left wing, opened the season with hat trick Oct. 10 against Philadelphia, scoring all three of his goals in the final period, two of them within a 38-second span to lead New Jersey to a comeback 6-5 victory in the Spectrum.

title: Shamrock-Ghana Deal
description: Diamond Shamrock International signed an agreement with the Ghanaian Government today that allows the company to search for oil in the onshore Keta Basin, the Ghana News Agency reported.

title: SAHARA RESORTS reports earnings for Year to Sept 30
description: The company was formerly Hacienda Resorts Inc.

title: U.N. Assembly Assails Israel On Occupation of Arab Lands
description: The General Assembly adopted three resolutions today condemning Israel's occupation of Arab territories as the core of the conflict in the Middle East.

title: Advertising;   A Big Year For FCB Associated
description: AROUND Foote, Cone & Belding Communications Abbott C. Jones is known as ''president of everything else.''

title: Rise in Food Demand From Private Groups
description: A report showing a 17 percent increase in the demand for food provided by private assistance programs was made public today by the Food Research Action Center, a Washington public interest organization.

title: EXCERPT'S FROM MARCO'S INTERVIEW ON HIS SOLDOERS AND FOES
description: Following are excerpts from President Ferdinand E. Marcos's responses in an interview today with The New York Times:

title: E.P.A. LISTS DANGERS OF MORE THAN 400 CHEMICALS
description: The Federal Government today is to release for the first time detailed information on just how dangerous more than 400 highly toxic chemicals could be to communities in the event of an accident.

title: HALLWOOD GROUP reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
Satellite Conference Links Heart Specialists
description: Leading American heart specialists talked today via satellite with their Soviet colleagues, including the Nobel laureate Dr. Eugeni Chazov, about the No. 1 killer in both nations -heart disease.

title: JETRONIC INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: Share earnings reflect a 10 percent stock dividend paid in July.

title: Watch Out Billy Packer, Here Comes John Sparks
description: Chris Tomasson is a man with a mission: ''to choose a complete amateur,'' he says, ''and make him a star.''

title: RESPECT FOR CALCIUM'S ROLE GROWS WITH NEW RESEARCH
description: CALCIUM, already drawing a great deal of attention for its critical role in preventing osteoporosis, the degenerative bone disease, is fast expanding its reputation as an essential part of the diet. At the same time, however, some health experts worry that the value of the nutrient is being overstated and that calcium supplements are being oversold.

title: TRITON GROUP reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 1
description: b-Including extraordinary income of $3,608,000 for the quarter and $7,886,000 for the 9 months. c-Net losses. d-After a loss of $7 million from discontinued operations.

title: Topics;   Seasons, Baseball and Holiday Roger Maris*
description: ''A season's a season,'' Roger Maris said in 1961, when they hung the asterisk after his name in the baseball record book. Why didn't his 61 home runs that year, when the season was eight games longer, stand without qualification as the record, displacing Babe Ruth's 60?

title: Business Decision
description: Magic Johnson, asked what would be the first thing to do if he ever played on the same team as Ralph Sampson: ''Order the rings for the next 10 years.''

title: THE SOURCES OF ENERGY
description: ''POWER STRUGGLE'' is clear about its perspective. Credit it for candor.

title: ROBERT A. O'BRIEN
description: Robert A. O'Brien, an editor and writer, died of cancer yesterday at Lenox Hill Hospital.

title: Jets Not Sound for Last Game
description: Ken O'Brien's arm, pounded almost weekly, is not very sound right now and neither are the Jets, who have struggled in these last, clutch weeks.

title: NEW HEMINGWAY NOVEL TO BE PUBLISHED IN MAY
description: An unpublished novel that Ernest Hemingway worked on over the course of 15 years will be published next May by Charles Scribner's Sons. Titled ''The Garden of Eden,'' the book deals with a young American writer and his wife of three weeks, both of whom are attracted to the same woman.

title: THEATER: 'A SEAGULL' IN WASHINGTON
description: At the climax of ''A Seagull,'' Peter Sellars's revamping of the play by Chekhov, Paul Winfield, as the doctor, goes offstage to investigate the sound of a gunshot - and the other actors freeze in a tableau. Mr. Winfield is gone so long that one begins to wonder if the actor, fed up with the production's diminution of its source, has gone home. Such is not the case, and the evening ends as in Chekhov, but strange are the vagaries that have led the director into the never-never land of his ''Seagull.''

title: BERGEN BRUNSWIG CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
PIONEER IMMACULATA RECALLS A SIMPLER ERA
description: If one listens carefully, perhaps the echoes of the buckets and sticks can still be faintly heard reverberating across the secluded, 373-acre campus that gives Immaculata College a monastic atmosphere. In the good old days of women's intercollegiate basketball in the early 1970's, this women's Catholic school raised three national championship banners in a gymnasium that did not have permanent bleachers to accommodate the small legion of enthusiasts who followed the first dynasty in women's sports.

title: Return Vowed
description: Several youngsters stood in a lobby of Madison Square Garden yesterday morning before a color, life-size photograph of Bernard King driving to the basket.

title: Greetings
description: There are some Christmas cards that are probably peculiar to Washington.

title: PRINCETON MALE CLUBS RULED SUBJECT TO JERSEY'S BIAS LAW
description: Princeton University's three all-male eating clubs are public accommodations subject to New Jersey's antidiscrimination laws, a state administrative law judge ruled today.

title: ALGERIANS ASSAIL ONE-PARTY RULE
description: Ahmed Ben Bella, the first Prime Minister of Algeria after it gained independence from France, and Hocine Ait-Ahmed, another of the founders of modern Algeria, today announced the formation of a united front to oppose the one-party rule of the group they helped establish 31 years ago.

title: United Technologies
description: The United Technologies Corporation announced yesterday that its board of directors had declared a dividend distribution of one common stock purchase right on each outstanding share of its common stock.

title: The Real Problem Is Housing
description: Mayor Koch's order to remove homeless people from the streets when the temperature drops to 32 degrees is a misdirected policy that diverts public discussion from the underlying causes of homelessness. The directive encourages the rest of us to see the homeless as mentally ill -and allows us to neglect the real problem, lack of adequate housing.

title: Multiparty Candidates
description: To the Editor:

title: OPERETTA: 'RUDDYGORE'
description: WHEN the long original run of ''The Mikado'' finally drew to a close, Gilbert and Sullivan offered their public a melodramatic successor entitled ''Ruddygore,'' which recently had a run at the Fashion Institute Theater, played by the Village Light Opera Group.

title: JURY CLEARS REED IN AMAX CASE
description: Thomas C. Reed, a former special assistant to President Reagan for national security affairs, was acquitted yesterday of charges that he used inside information to turn a $427,000 profit by trading in stock market options four years ago.

title: THE DANCE: MARK MORRIS TROUPE
description: IT was something of an event when the Mark Morris Dance Group performed Sunday afternoon and evening at the Bessie Schonberg Theater, 219 West 19th Street, where the company appears through Dec. 22. So crowded was the theater that those sitting on the floor in the first of three added rows in the evening were asked to tuck in their knees and shopping bags so the dancers could move.

title: CHARTER COMPANY STILL FLIES FOR U.S.
description: The Defense Department is continuing to fly people and cargo aboard planes chartered from Arrow Air despite the crash last week in Newfoundland that took the lives of 248 soldiers from the 101st Airborne Division.

title: U.S. OPENS IT CASE IN FAVOR OF PROMOTING WHITE FIREMAN
description: The United States Justice Department went to trial today in Federal District Court in support of white firefighters here who contend that the city's affirmative action program made them victims of reverse discrimination.

title: A TALE ABOUT A PLACE THAT LOVES CHRISTMAS
description: Once there was a place that almost missed Christmas twice. It was not an extraordinary place in any other way, which is what made the Christmas trouble so puzzling.

title: Focus On Mental Health
description: Every night, several thousand homeless people sleep in the streets of New York City in cardboard boxes or huddled on heating grates. Neither the lack of adequate low-income housing or of homeless shelters can alone be blamed for their plights. A large proportion of them are the victims of a ruthless cycle of neglect that began with the policy known as ''deinstitutionalization'' - the discharge of some 126,000 people from New York State mental hospitals between 1965 and 1977.

title: SALVADOR POLICE ACCUSED OF RAPE
description: A former Salvadoran employee of the United States Embassy here has charged that Salvadoran policemen raped and physically tormented her after she was detained three months ago by American security personnel on suspicion of being a guerrilla spy.

title: Bridge: Some Unconventional Bids Created Shock, Then a Slam
description: If you are long in your partner's suit and short in the opponents' you should tend to bid, but if the contrary is true you should tend to defend.

title: Topics;   Seasons, Baseball and Holiday Decorations
description: At Rockefeller Center, a giant tree with an honor guard of angels. At Trump Tower, trees, garlands and a waterfall in full flow.

title: TOP SURGEON REPRIMANDED ON PROCEDURE
description: THE leader of one of the nation's most experienced bone-marrow transplant teams has been reprimanded by the National Institutes of Health for failing to clear some of the operations in advance with his institution's review board.

title: HAVANA DEFECTOR KNOWS ARMS DATA
description: The Cuban defector who was the subject of a foiled kidnapping attempt last week had inside knowledge about Cuban arms sales and purchases and about overseas military ventures in such countries as Angola, according to Spanish officials and to Cuban exiles here.

title: REAGAN'S BLEAK DAYS
description: Less than one month after President Reagan received bipartisan acclaim at a joint session of Congress on returning from the Geneva summit meeting, he went back to Capitol Hill this afternoon in perhaps the bleakest turn of his relations with the House and Senate.

title: WELDOTRON CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
WAUSAU PAPER MILLS CO reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
GREAT AMERICAN MANAGEMENT & INVESTMENT INC reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
That Chip Investigation
description: The White House has authorized the Commerce Department to start a full-scale investigation within the next few days of Japan's possibly unfair practices in the trading of high-capacity computer memory chips.

title: TRW Expects Loss in Period
description: TRW Inc. said today that it expects to report a loss in its fourth quarter resulting from the costs of a restructuring program announced in September.

title: MEXICO QUAKE THWARTS THEORY ON PREDICTION
description: FOR years, many scientists have believed that a correlation should exist between the size of an earthquake and the number and diversity of its warning signs. If interpreted correctly, the scientists said, these signs could point to the most likely location, time and size of a future shock, giving government agencies time to begin mobilizing their resources and allowing individualss to start taking appropriate safety precautions.

title: VALUE LINE INC reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
2 CITED BY HOUSE PANEL ARE ACTIVE IN REAL ESTATE
description: The brothers cited for contempt of Congress in an investigation of purported real estate holdings of the Marcos family have been important figures in New York real estate for four years.

title: FOREST CITY ENTERPRISES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: b-Net income.

title: AUDIO-VIDEO AFFILIATES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
Staying Warm as Toast
description: It isn't infrequent that opposing players have to make way for William Perry, and now Jim Palmer knows how they feel.

title: Business and Health;   Cost Squeeze On Hospitals
description: THE squeeze on hospital costs has begun to yield results. Federal Medicare paid hospitals $2 billion less than forecast last year. Bucking a 20-year trend, health care's share of the gross national product showed a slight decrease, to 10.6 percent from 10.7 percent.

title: In Search of Donations
description: ''Won't you give whatever you can to the homeless? Anything will help.''

title: FIFTH AVE. JEWELER IS ACCUSED OF AIDING SALES-TAX EVASION
description: The president and the controller of Van Cleef & Arpels Inc. were indicted yesterday on charges of scheming to help customers evade city and state sales taxes on more than $4.6 million in jewelry.

title: NOTES ON FASHION
description: ALL, as they say, that glitters is not gold. In fashion, it may be sequins or rhinestones or Lurex thread. And all those sham sparklers have been out in full force at preholiday parties. Cher won the Sparkle Plenty award at the Indian exhibition party at the Metropolitan Museum of Art last Monday with a sheer black dress covered in rhinestones and a gigantic rhinestone earring worn like an earmuff.

title: SEVEN OAKS INTERNATIONAL INC reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: b-After a loss of $74,000 for the quarter and 6 months relating to the company's 28 percent investment in CSI Telemarketing Inc.

title: Massey-Ferguson Plans Restructure
description: Massey-Ferguson Ltd. said it would ask shareholders to approve a debt-restructuring plan in early 1986 that would exclude the company's combines business from its future financial results. It said its Ontario-based combines and foundries divisions, which lost about $35 million in the nine months ended Oct. 31, would be recapitalized as a privately held associate company in which Massey-Ferguson would hold a minority interest.

title: AGENCIES SAY TREASURY ERRED IN HANDLING OF SOCIAL SECURITY FUNDS
description: Two Congressional agencies said today that the Reagan Administration appeared to have violated the Social Security Act by manipulating Social Security trust funds.

title: Fish Oil and Heart Disease
description: To test the suspected role of fish oil in reducing the risk of heart disease, selected members of an Australian Antarctic expedition are to be fed half-ounce capsules of fish oil daily. During the six-week experiment, researchers will monitor their blood pressure and blood levels of fatty substances, such as triglycerides, that are thought to be related to blood stream congestion.

title: Searches Are Upheld In Coast Spying Case
description: Evidence from two searches of Jerry A. Whitworth's home may be used at his espionage trial, a Federal district judge ruled today, rejecting arguments that the searches were improper.

title: JUMPING-JACKS SHOES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
JURY IN SEATTLE GETS CASE AGAINST NEO-NAZIS
description: After more than three months of testimony from 370 witnesses, a jury began deliberations here today in the Federal racketeering trial of 10 members of a neo-Nazi group, the Order.

title: AZRIEL EISENBERG
description: Azriel Eisenberg, former executive vice president of the Jewish Education Committee, now the Board of Jewish Education, died at Booth Memorial Hospital in Queens Sunday. He was 82 years old and lived in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: HOME OWNERS FEDERAL SAVINGS & LOAN ASSN reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-After an extraordinary gain of $284,000 from a stock dividend paid by the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp. c-Not available because the company went public in June 1984.

title: NEW PLAN REALTY TRUST reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: b-Including a gain of $701,000 on the sale of properties.

title: Chrysler Buyback
description: The Chrysler Corporation said it would step up its stock purchase program by buying back about 9.5 million shares from workers in the Employee Stock Ownership Plan. The purchases, which the company agreed to last October before a 12-day auto workers' strike, are in addition to a program announced in December 1984 when Chrysler said it would buy up to 25 million shares of its common stock. So far, Chrysler has acquired 13.7 million shares under that program and when the ESOP purchase is complete, expected by the end of this year, the company will have acquired almost 20 percent of its outstanding shares.

title: TELEVIDEO SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: b-Net loss. c-Net income.

title: Factory Use Up a Bit After 2-Month Decline
description: The operating rate at American factories, mines and utilities edged up slightly in November after two consecutive declines, the Federal Reserve Board said today.

title: New Telephone Line Gives Comet Updates
description: A new Comet Halley Hot Line, to keep fans of the returning comet on top of its whereabouts, went into service today.

title: Universal's 'Brazil' Set For U.S. Release Dec.25
description: ''Brazil,'' the movie that was named best picture of the year by the Los Angeles Film Critics Association without having opened in this country, will begin a special one-week engagement in New York and Los Angeles on Dec. 25 to qualify for the Academy Awards. Ed Roginski, senior vice president in charge of marketing for Universal Studios, said the film - a futuristic black comedy set in an Orwellian nightmare world -would begin regular theatrical engagements around the country Feb. 14.

title: S.E.C. Confirmation
description: The Senate approved by voice vote today the nomination of Edward H. Fleishman to the Securities and Exchange Commission. The confirmation of Mr. Fleishman, a Republican, gives the S.E.C. a full five-member commission for the first time since April 17and clears the way for a long awaited S.E.C. review of its regulation of corporate takeovers and tender offers.

title: MONY REAL ESTATE INVES reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
description: b-Including gains of $2,219,000, or 22 cents a share, for the quarter and $2,261,000, or 23 cents a share, for the 6 months from the sale of investments.

title: U.S.-Soviet Agreement On Terror Pact Reported
description: The United States and the Soviet Union have agreed for the first time on a comprehensive resolution condemning the taking of hostages, high-level diplomatic sources said today.

title: DOW JUMPS 17.89 MORE, ENDING DAY AT 1,553.10
description: Stock prices again jumped to record levels yesterday, at least partly because of technical factors that occur once every three months.

title: DIPLOMATS CITE GROWING SIGNS OF CEAUSESCU ILLNESS
description: President Nicolae Ceausescu's frail appearance in recent months and signs that official photographs of him have been altered have reinforced speculation that he is seriously ill, according to Western diplomats and others here.

title: PRISM ENTERTAINMENT reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Larouche Could Return
description: As the quality of the Rangers's play continues to shift almost daily, it is becoming evident that what was their No. 1 need before the start of the season has become their No. 1 problem. They still lack the surefire scorer.

title: Article 231479 -- No Title
description: The stock of the Midcon Corporation rose by $1.625 yesterday after two energy companies announced an offer to buy the company for $62.50 a share, or a total of $2.7 billion. The stock closed at $63.375 on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: GEORGE A. FRIEDMAN
description: Dr. George A. Friedman, a physician who wrote frequently about the relationship between medicine and the law, died of an aneurysm Saturday at North Shore University Hospital in Manhasset, L.I. He was 75 years old and lived in Plandome Manor, L.I.

title: METRO AIRLINES reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: b-Including pretax gains of $1,455,000 for the quarter and $1,568,000 for the 6 months from the sale of Houston-based assets. c-Including pretax gains of $49,000 for the quarter and $50,000 for the 6 months from the sale of assets.

title: LUBY'S CAFETERIAS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
Giants Down to Final Chance
description: The Giants are down to their last chance, and that is all right with their coach, Bill Parcells. He said their first objective in training camp was to make the playoffs, and they can do that this weekend.

title: SELIGMAN & ASSOCIATES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
Let's Close a Loophole In Political Donations
description: To the Editor:

title: MUSIC: 'CHRISTMAS,' BY HEINRICH SCHUTZ
description: IDEAS about the past are so inextricable from our perceptions of the present that the series of wild guesses made at the Cathedral of St. John the Divine Saturday night troubled little if at all. Thus Heinrich Schutz's ''Christmas Story'' - which the Ensemble for Early Music presented in this huge space at 112th Street and Amsterdam Avenue - is really a 20th-century opera constructed from 17th-century materials.

title: SIR SEEWOOSAGUR RAMGOOLAM OF MAURITIUS IS DEAD AT 85
description: Sir Seewoosagur Ramgoolam, the first Prime Minister of Mauritius and regarded as the father of that small island nation in the western Indian Ocean, died Sunday after a long illness. He was 85 years old. Sir Seewoosagur, a former physician, led Mauritius to independence from Britain in 1968 and remained Prime Minister until 1982, when his Labor Party was defeated by a left-wing alliance in a general election. He was appointed Governor General in 1983 and held that largely ceremonial Commonwealth office at his death.

title: A World Economy Idling in Neutral
description: The prices of raw materials - rubber, copper, sugar - are in a worldwide nosedive. It's the 1970's in reverse: OPEC can't hold the line against declining oil prices. The international cartel that guarded the price of tin collapsed in a flurry of uncollectible i.o.u.'s in October.

title: Dr. Forrest Shaklee; Founded Corporation
description: Dr. Forrest Shaklee Sr., founder of the Shaklee Corporation, died of a heart attack Sunday.

title: A Bank on the Move
description: The Inter-American Development Bank's principal function is to help the economies of Latin American countries by lending them money. Now, the organization is expected to help the economy of downtown Washington without lending a dime.

title: TAB PRODUCTS CO reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
description: The latest 6 months results included non-recurring expenditures in connection with a consolidation of the company's manufacturing operations.

title: AUTHORITIES FORESEE POWER STRUGGLE
description: The murder of Paul Castellano was viewed by high-ranking law-enforcement officials last night as the start of a struggle for control of the country's strongest organized-crime group - the Gambino faction.

title: Edwin Steffek, Garden Expert And Former Editor, Dies at 73
description: Edwin F. Steffek, a gardening expert and former editor of Horticulture magazine, died Friday after a heart attack.

title: ISRAELIS WARY ON STRIKING AT MISSILES
description: Israeli leaders said today that they did not intend to carry out any pre-emptive action against the new Syrian surface-to-air missile deployments, provided the Syrians did not fire on Israeli planes flying over Lebanon.

title: WIDOW SAYS ARMY OFFICER FEARED PLANE'S CONDITION
description: The Arrow Air jet that took elements of the 101st Airborne Division to the Middle East in July appeared so rickety to an officer and his wife that both worried about the safety of the return trip, the captain's widow says.

title: NEW LAKER WORKS HARD
description: There are various ways that a relatively unknown rookie could have coped with the long-shot challenge of trying to earn a place on the roster of the world champion Los Angeles Lakers.

title: MARCOS SAYS U.S. ACTIONS HELP DIVIDE HIS ARMY
description: President Ferdinand E. Marcos said today that American pressure to remove the Chief of Staff, Gen. Fabian C. Ver, had contributed to a factional dispute that was hampering the work of the Philippine military.

title: 'LOVE IS NEVER LOST,' REAGAN TELLS CRASH VICTIMS' GRIEVING FAMILIES
description: Saying that ''love is never wasted, love is never lost,'' President Reagan came here today to embrace weeping families of the 248 American soldiers who died in a plane crash in Newfoundland last Thursday.

title: MEDICAL SCHOOL QUALITY
description: AN urgent appeal issued five years ago to stop the influx of graduates of inferior foreign medical schools into the United States has gone largely unheeded.

title: Judge Delays Ruling On Goetz to Jan. 21
description: The judge in the attempted-murder case of Bernhard H. Goetz said yesterday that he would postpone until Jan. 21 a decision on a defense request to dismiss the charges.

title: 2 Americans Freed in Chad
description: Two Americans employed by a United States oil exploration company were kidnapped by rebel forces in southern Chad last month and were freed unharmed by Chad Government forces after being held for 15 days, the State Department said today. The men, employed by Esso-Chad, were seized on Nov. 23 and set free on Dec. 8. An official at the parent company, Esso Exploration Inc., based in Houston, declined to discuss the incident.

title: 'STAR WARS' IN STRATEGY: THE RUSSIAN RESPONSE
description: The debate over the ''Star Wars'' missile defense program is increasingly shifting to arguments about its real military value, as opposed to its mere technical feasibility.

title: NEW MAPS TO HELP RIDER GAIN HIS JOURNEY'S END
description: You can get there from here, after all.

title: A.B.A. Urged to Back Antioch
description: Nine members of Congress, including the chairman of the House Judiciary Committee, strongly urged the American Bar Association Sunday to continue its professional accreditation of the Antioch Law School here.

title: PROLER INTERNATIONAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: b-Net income

title: MICRONESIA PACT ENDS U.S. CONTROL
description: After nearly 16 years of complicated negotiations, Congress has approved legislation that would end Unites States' stewardship of the Micronesian islands in the Pacific Ocean.

title: Director Named at Los Alamos
description: Siegfried S. Hecker has been named director of Los Alamos National Laboratory, the weapons research center where the first atomic bomb was developed during World War II, the University of California has announced.

title: China Trade Rules Eased
description: The Reagan Administration said today that it was relaxing restrictions on many goods exported to China.

title: ANALOGIC CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: Year-ago results have been restated to reflect results of operations of 3H Industries, acquired in May 1985.

title: PERRY DRUG STORES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: The share earnings are fully diluted and reflect a 3-for-2 stock split in September.

title: KING VOWS RETURN 'I'M A FIGHTER'
description: Showing the same singularity of purpose with which he drives to the basket, Bernard King came out of seclusion yesterday, interrupting his daily rehabilition for a few hours to demonstrate to the media swarm that, as Mark Twain said before him, ''rumors of my death are greatly exaggerated.''

title: TEXACO SUES TO EASE PRESSURE ON IT
description: Texaco Inc., seeking to strengthen its bargaining and legal position in its battle with the Pennzoil Company, said yesterday that it had filed a lawsuit in a Federal court. The suit is intended to let Texaco appeal a Texas state court's decision without suffering financial hardship that could force the company into bankruptcy proceedings.

title: BOWNE & CO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: b-Including capital gains of $232,000 for the latest year and $355,000 for the previous year.

title: Urban Guerrilla Suspects Are Captured in Belgium
description: Four people were arrested today in a major breakthrough against urban guerrillas, Justice Minister Jean Gol said.

title: British Film Producer Is Missing in Lebanon
description: Chris Wenner, a freelance British documentary producer, has been missing for 18 days and is feared kidnapped, a colleague reported today.

title: REAGAN REPORTED TO GET TAX VOTES IN APPEAL TO G.O.P.
description: President Reagan made an extraordinary personal appeal to Republican lawmakers today and was reported to have won enough votes to assure passage of tax-revision legislation in the House of Representatives.

title: WORTHINGTON INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
description: The share earnings reflect a 3-for-2 stock split paid in October.

title: TRADING OF AIRPORT TIME SLOTS
description: The Department of Transportation today adopted a rule granting major air carriers and commuter airlines authority to buy, sell, trade and lease their arrival and departure slots at four airports where the number of flights per hour are restricted by the Government.

title: MUTUAL FUNDS' HISTORIC BOOM
description: Wall Street's little guy is coming back to the stock and bond markets. But this time he is asking others to place his bets for him.

title: DANCE: ROYAL MARINES AND 'CHRISTMAS REVELS'
description: The marching bands of Her Majesty's Royal Marines and of the Argyll and Sutherland Highlanders might seem to have little in common with New York's merriest solstice celebration, ''The Christmas Revels,'' except that both were on view this weekend and both - on the parade ground or in homespun mummer's plays - were originally conceived as pageants.

title: Advertising;   Martin Agency Wins An Insurance Account
description: The Life Insurance Company of Virginia has assigned its account -formerly handled in New York - to the Martin Agency in Richmond.

title: Apology for Athletes
description: E. J. (Doc) Kreis, the former Vanderbilt University strength coach, said he regreted obtaining steroids without a prescription and broke more than a year of silence to apologize to athletes, the school and others ''touched by my mistake.'' The 34-year-old Kreis was sentenced Nov. 27 to 11 months and 29 days of unsupervised probation after pleading guilty earlier to mailing illegally obtained anabolic steroids to Sam Colson, who was the strength coach at Clemson at the time. ''What I did was wrong and I want to apologize to those people who have been touched by my mistake,'' Kreis told The Tennessean in a story in Sunday's editions.

title: Petroleum Prices Ease And Coffee Soars Again
description: Prices for crude oil and petroleum products fell slightly in moderate trading yesterday on the New York Mercantile Exchange despite a forecast of sharply colder weather for the East Coast.

ANTI-NUCLEAR DOCTORS ANNOUNCE THEY WILL MEET WITH GORBACHEV
description: The Soviet and American founders of International Physicians for the Prevention of Nuclear War, the group that was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize earlier this month, will meet with the Soviet leader, Mikhail S. Gorbachev, in Moscow on Wednesday, the organization announced here today.

title: SOUTH AFRICA HOLDS TV CREWMEN, CITING AN UNSPECIFIED 'NEW ACT'
description: The South African police today reported the arrest of two television journalists under the internal security laws.

title: JURY IN THE EDWARDS CASE PAUSES FOR A RULING
description: A Federal jury, unable to reach a verdict in the racketeering trial of Gov. Edwin W. Edwards, today discontinued deliberations pending further instructions from the judge.

title: Guatemalan Is Found Slain
description: The mutilated body of a teacher has been found near here, and a recently revived right-wing death squad, the Secret Anti-Communist Army, is believed to be responsible for her killing, police officers said today. The body of Beatriz Barrios Marroquin, 27 years old, was found Thursday, a police official said.

title: FILM: ' THE COLOR PURPLE,' FROM STEVEN SPIELBERG
description: SWEETNESS and stridency exist side by side in Alice Walker's ''Color Purple,'' a book whose great virtue is the conversational immediacy that lets its characters spring to life on the page. In Steven Spielberg's film version, which opens today at the Beekman and other theaters, the characters are also big and vibrant, but beyond that they resemble Miss Walker's barely at all. Mr. Spielberg has looked on the sunny side of Miss Walker's novel, fashioning a grand, multi-hanky entertainment that is as pretty and lavish as the book is plain. If the book is set in the harsh, impoverished atmosphere of rural Georgia, the movie unfolds in a cozy, comfortable, flower-filled wonderland.

title: CLABIR CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: b-Including tax credits of $305,000 for the quarter and $1,102,000 for the 9 months. c-Including tax credits of $256,000 for the quarter and $2,397,000 for the 9 months.

title: HOLIDAY CLASSICS TO GIVE THE COOK A MAGIC TOUCH
description: THE holiday season calls for a little glitter and glamour in dress, home decorating, entertaining and cooking. Indeed, the spirit of the season may inspire home cooks to attempt a festive dish that they have been meaning to make but have rarely had the opportunity or courage to confront.

title: CUOMO CONDEMNS USE OF 'MAFIA' FOR DESCRIBING ORGANIZED CRIME
description: Governor Cuomo spoke out today against ethnic slights and stereotypes that he said had been inflicted on himself and other Italian-Americans.

description: Robert Loeb, a vice president and shareholder of the brokerage and investment firm of Kidder, Peabody & Company, died yesterday. He was 56 years old.

description: Two neighboring suburbs, one rich and the other not, are competing for the right to educate the high school students of Englewood Cliffs, a third community that borders them.

CALIFORNIA OFFICIAL INVESTIGATING COMPUTER VOTING SYSTEM SECURITY
description: Attorney General John K. Van de Kamp of California has begun an inquiry into the adequacy of the security safeguards of computerized voting equipment used in California and other states.

title: FOR LAST-MINUTE SHOPPERS
description: THOSE who have waited until the last minute to do their Christmas shopping need not despair. A number of stores around town still have good selections of gifts in ample quantities. Following are some suggestions. 1.

title: BUCKLEY APPROVED AS APPEALS JUDGE
description: The Senate today confirmed James L. Buckley as a judge on the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia over the objections of the two Senators from his home state, Connecticut.

title: Burlington Northern Promotes 2 Executives
description: Burlington Northern Inc., the railroad and natural gas company, announced that Walter A. Drexel, chairman and chief executive of its Burlington Northern Railroad subsidiary, had been named a vice chairman of the parent company.

title: CBS Agrees to Sell Praeger Publishers Unit
description: CBS Inc. announced yesterday that it had signed an agreement to sell Praeger Publishers to Greenwood Press Inc., a subsidiary of Congressional Information Service Inc. Terms of the agreement were not disclosed.

title: Jack Valenti's State Department
description: He is not quite the Secretary of State. Instead of embassies in 140 countries, Jack Valenti, president of the Motion Picture Association of America, has listening posts in 60 countries. Instead of 14,000 diplomats overseas, he has 300.

GANDHI-ZIA TALKS SAID TO BEAR FRUIT
description: The leaders of India and Pakistan pledged today not to attack each other's nuclear installations and to make a major new effort to resolve several disagreements that have increased tensions this year.

title: Reagan and Mexican Leader To Meet Jan. 3 in Border City
description: President Reagan will visit Mexicali, Mexico, on Jan. 3 to meet with President Miguel de la Madrid, the White House announced today.

title: Hughey Resigning Environment Post
description: Robert E. Hughey, the New Jersey Commissioner of Environmental Protection since 1982, said today that he would resign Jan. 30.

title: Quake Jars Pakistani City
description: Residents and workers fled from homes and offices today when an earthquake rattled the country's largest city, but the authorities reported no injuries and only slight damage.

title: Peacecheaters, Video Fireplaces
description: Technology does not exist in a vacuum. The Apple computer, Sony Walkman and Cuisinart are just a few of the gadgets that seemed innocuous in the laboratory. Yet after they entered the marketplace, they changed Americans' life styles forever. Now, industry is hard at work to come up with the next revenue-producers. Inside sources have offered a peek at some developments that might emerge in 1986.

title: SUSPENSION & PARTS INDUSTRY LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Sept 30
Q&A

title: 'TRIPODS,' SCIENCE-FICTION TRILOGY
description: IF you didn't watch the adaptation of the first book of ''Tripods,'' John Christopher's science-fiction trilogy, which was shown on Channel 13 earlier this year, you can play catch-up at 8:30 tonight with the first of 12 half-hour shows in Alick Rowe's adaptation of the second book, ''The City of Gold and Lead.'' If you did watch, here's more of the same.

title: Operation Delayed
description: The operation to save Stephen's Odyssey, a 3-year old colt, whose racing career ended when he suffered a broken bone in his left front leg during a Sunday workout, has been delayed because of complications, according to Jenny Orsteen, the director of special events at Hialeah Park. ''I spoke to trainer Woody Stephens this morning,'' said Miss Orsteen, ''and as of that time they had difficulty with blood clots in the leg.

title: CUSTOMS SERVICE PLAYS SANTA
description: More than 11,000 toys confiscated by the Customs office in the last year have been donated to a program that provides Christmas gifts for needy children.

title: Merrill Lynch Trader To Head Unit in Japan
description: Merrill Lynch, which along with two American investment banks was recently awarded a seat on the Tokyo Stock Exchange, has named its chief equity trader to become president of Merrill Lynch Japan.

title: AT IOWA, HARMONY THROUGH EQUAL PARTNERSHIP
description: Jim White popped the promotional tape into the video cassette recorder, leaned back and let the good times roll. Major college athletics is big business and the way it is packaged and sold can have a bearing on a winning fiscal season. Still, as anyone in the field of marketing and promotions learns, nothing sells like success, and only so much whipped cream can be spread on a program lacking substance. No one makes video cassettes about losers.

title: Trade Deficit Surges in U.S.
description: The broadest measure of American trade surged to a near-record deficit of $30.5 billion from July through September as America plunged further into the hole as a net debtor country, the Government said today.

title: Cafe des Artistes Making a Comeback
description: Diners at the Cafe des Artistes were interrupted in the middle of dinner when a fire broke out in the kitchen recently.

title: United Westburne
description: Westburne International Industries, a retail company that also has oil and gas holdings, said a group including management and employees of its United Westburne Industries subsidiary is offering to repurchase all United Westburne shares for $144.5 million (Canadian currency). The company also said the group includes Westburne International's chairman, John A. Scrymgeour, and president, Sam Abramovitch.

title: NEWS SUMMARY: WEDNESDAY, DECEMBER 18, 1985
description: International Secretary of State George P. Shultz reacted angrily on the issue of terrorism during a visit to Belgrade after the Yugoslav Foreign Minister had commented about the October hijacking of the Italian cruise ship Achille Lauro, in which an American was killed. Foreign Minister Raid Dizdarevic had said at a news conference that, although Yugoslavia condemned terrorism, ''one must also view the causes that lead to it.'' Mr. Shultz pounded the table and said, ''There must be no place to hide for people who do that kind of thing.'' [Page A1, Column 3.]

title: Red Cross Worker Is Killed
description: A Swiss delegate of the International Committee of the Red Cross was shot dead near Lobito, Angola, on Monday night, the organization said today. The group, with headquarters here, said in a statement that the victim, Marc Blaser, 21 years old, went to Angola last October as a radio operator.

title: IMPROVED AFRICAN FOOD OUTLOOK SEEN AT U.N.
description: Improved harvests in several African countries have given the continent enough food to feed itself next year, a United Nations official said today.

HEINICKE INSTRUMENTS CO reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31

description: For the vast majority of the nation's Federal prison inmates, Christmas gifts will come not from relatives and friends this year but from penitentiary commissary.

title: Standard Format a Goal On Taxable Industrials
description: Officials of local governments across the country are backing a plan to develop a standardized type of industrial development bond that would be sold in the taxable bond market.

title: SCREEN: 'OUT OF AFRICA,' STARRING MERYL STREEP
description: FROM 1913 to 1931 Karen Blixen (1885-1962), the Danish writer who was later to publish under the name of Isak Dinesen, lived in British East Africa, now Kenya, where she ran a large coffee plantation. She had originally come out to Africa to marry the Swedish-born Baron Bror Blixen, who was her cousin as well as the twin brother of Hans Blixen, the man she really loved but who had jilted her.

description: Following is the text of the letter President Reagan sent to Republican members of the House of Representatives today asking them to support the tax bill drafted by the Democratic majority of the Ways and Means Committee:
